Description: Rim sherd of Attic black-figured pottery lip-cup; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed black below; top of rim glazed; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of head of lion to right with added white on teeth and added red dot behind ear; at right, foreparts of grazing goat with red neck and white marking on shoulder, to left; below junction with body, marked by black band.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 386, no. B549)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0554) (Phase 1)
Heesen 2011 / Athenian Little-Master Cups (p. 294, no. 297, pl. 85c)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
